meta_description: Explore the colorful history of Golden, Colorado and travel through time experience dinosaurs, cowboys, trains and more with dynamic exhibits, engaging programs, and amazing collections at three different locations.
hours_text:
# History Museum

  * 

## History Museum, open and free, Tuesday – Saturday, 10 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.

The History Museum is a warm, welcoming, and vibrant public space for uncovering and sharing our past. The exhibits at Golden History Museum include versatile programming spaces, a hands-on gallery for families with young children, and dynamic displays that highlight the City’s collection of 15,000 historic objects. Discover your own favorite artifacts in-person and then continue your learning journey at home or in your local coffee shop using our [extensive online collection](https://goldenhistory.pastperfectonline.com/).

Combine your museum visit with a variety of other entertaining pastimes in downtown Golden. Enjoy our world-class outdoor recreation, cultural attractions, local charm, and the Coors Brewery, the largest single-site brewery in the world, located walking distance from the museum. [Learn more at VisitGolden.com](https://www.visitgolden.com/).

### Hours and Admission

Open Tuesday – Saturday, 10 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.. Admission is free, courtesy of generous donors just like you. [Contribute here](https://www.goldenhistory.org/get-involved/donate/).

### Closures for Holidays and Special Events

Sundays, Mondays _,_ Easter, Thanksgiving Eve, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas, New Year’s Eve, and New Year’s Day.

Additionally, the museum will be closed:

  * April 28-May 1, 2026, for [Indigenous Connections Summit](https://www.goldenhistory.org/learn-do/indigenou...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility Statement

## Accessibility Statement for Golden History Museum & Park

This is an accessibility statement from Golden History Museum & Park, part of the City of Golden.

## An Inclusive Golden

The City of Golden is dedicated to ensuring all residents and visitors have equal access to our services, programs, and facilities. We are committed to fostering an inclusive community while upholding the principles of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and CO HB21-1110.

## Our Commitment to Accessibility

In compliance with Title II of the ADA, the City of Golden does not discriminate against individuals with disabilities in any of our services, programs, or activities. We work to remove barriers and provide reasonable modifications to ensure equitable participation for everyone.

Examples of our commitment include:

  * Providing, upon request, auxiliary aids and services, such as qualified sign language interpreters or documents in Braille.
  * Welcoming service animals in City offices, even where pets are not allowed.
  * Offering assistance to access items or services that may not be directly reachable for individuals using mobility devices.

### Digital Accessibility

We strive to make our digital content accessible to all. Our website is designed and maintained to meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 AA standards, ensuring that people with disabilities can easily access information and interact with our online services. This is an ong...

  * 

# Golden history starts here

* * *

## Golden History Museum  

Visit today and meet the _[Legendary People](https://www.goldenhistory.org/visit/history-museum/current-exhibits/)_ who built Golden, learn why our local breweries are so famous, and explore Golden’s _[Epic Events](https://www.goldenhistory.org/visit/history-museum/current-exhibits/)_! Admission is always free. Open Tuesday – Saturday, 10 – 4:30. [Read more about the History Museum.](/museums/history-museum/)

* * *

##  Golden History Park

Get a taste of 1800s life at Golden History Park. View the old cabins, check out the Native American Arbor, and take a selfie in front of the one-room schoolhouse. It’s just a block from downtown and admission is free. [Read more about Golden History Park.](/museums/history-park/)
